brief_summary.textblock:
Hypothesis: Goal-directed echocardiography by trained critical care physicians is equivalent
      to that of echocardiography technicians/cardiologists for the purpose of determining
      etiology (reason) of cardiopulmonary failure.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Ultrasound of the Heart in Patients With Low Blood Pressure

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients who present to the medical intensive care unit with cardiopulmonary failure

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  None

study_pop.textblock: Patients who present to the medical intensive care unit with cardiopulmonary failure

clinical_study.official_title: Evaluating Critical Care Echocardiography in Patients With Cardiopulmonary Failure at the Time of Presentation

other_outcome.description: Will presence of RV dysfunction with critical care physicians versus echo techs/cardiologists be concordant in our population?

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.description: Will the assessment of left ventricular function by critical care physicians and echo techs be concordant?
primary_outcome.time_frame: within four hours of ICU admission

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: North Shore Long Island Jewish Health System
responsible_party.investigator_title: Chief Fellow, Pulmonary and Critical Care

secondary_outcome.description: Will the presence of pericardial effusion and severity from critical care physicians and echo techs be concordant?
secondary_outcome.measure: Presence of Pericardial Effusion and Severity

clinical_study.source: North Shore Long Island Jewish Health System

lead_sponsor.agency: North Shore Long Island Jewish Health System

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
